item.title: Upper bound for the stability of Boolean networks
item.description: arXiv:2506.12310v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Boolean networks, inspired by gene regulatory networks, were developed to understand the complex behaviors observed in biological systems, with network attractors corresponding to biological phenotypes or cell types. In this article, we present a proof for a conjecture by Williadsen, Triesch and Wiles about upper bounds for the stability of basins of attraction in Boolean networks. We further extend this result from a single basin of attraction to the entire network. Specifically, we demonstrate that the asymptotic upper bound for the robustness and the basin entropy of a Boolean network are negatively linearly related.
item.dc:creator: Venkata Sai Narayana Bavisetty, Matthew Wheeler, Reinhard Laubenbacher, Claus Kadelka
